results.title: Snow safe
results.creator_credit: Jack Creswick and Australian Ski Patrol Association
results.brief_description: A well produced video looking at all aspects of ski and snow safety. Covers appropriate clothing and equipment, selection of equipment, getting proper ski instruction, ski slope courtesy and behaviour, using lifts, ski slope signs, what to do in case of accident or getting lost, care of children, food and hypothermia, and safe tobogganing. Narrated by Debbie Byrne.

results.title: Senior Campus
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: In panel interviews, staff, students and parents of two schools, Bendigo Senior High and Kurani College, Morwell, discuss issues related to planning, developing and running of a senior campus and a school complex with a senior campus.

results.title: Science needs girls too
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: A program featuring Leonie Gianetto, Ursula Groves and Ann Osman from the McClintock Collective and students from Swinburne Community School and Swinburne Technical School who examine ways in which girls can be encouraged to take a more active part in the sciences.

results.title: Sexual harassment in schools
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program looks at some examples of sexual harassment in a school setting. Focuses on the consequences of harassing behaviour and avenues available to people who wish to take action to prevent it continuing. Ways of dealing with such incidences are suggested and legal rights under the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 are explained.

results.title: Red Tape
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program and shows a school community breaking down barriers to encourage community involvement in school decision making. The school draws its pupils from a housing commission estate and the principal’s aim is to create a school that responds to the community rather than the conventional process of making the commnity respond to the bureaucratic needs of the school.

results.title: Seeds of change
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Examines changes in Victorian farm life documenting its evolution from horse to tractor to modern machinery. Filmed on location at Jeparit, this program uses period re-creation and documentary footage.

results.title: Punkline
results.creator_credit: Tony Stevens, Sue Davis and Kali Productions
results.brief_description: Shot at the Crystal Ballroom and Festival Hall during performances of the B 52’s, The Cure, La Femme and The Models, this film provides an observation not of the New Wave performers, but of the people who go to see them. Soundtrack from a tape by Equal Local.

results.title: Red Nightmare
results.creator_credit: George Waggner, William L. Hendricks, United States. Dept. of Defense and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An anti communist drama sponsored by the U.S Government, supervised by Jack L. Warner and produced during the Cold War. The drama revolves around a small town American who takes his civil liberties for granted until he dreams of a communist takeover which jolts him out of his complacency. Narrated by Jack Webb. Photographed by Robert Hoffman. Written by Vincent Fotre. Music by William Lava. Edited by Folmer Blargsted. Starring Jack Kelly, Jeanne Cooper, Andrew Duggan, Peter Brown, Patricia Woodell, Peter Breck, Robert Conrad, Mike Road.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Waggner, William L. Hendricks, United States. Dept. of Defense and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: Shearing Yaks (Tajik People)
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Explains how the yak herds, which stay high in the mountains, where it is cool, are brought down to the village for shearing. The wool is pounded by men with sticks, spun into yarn and kept until there is enough to make a carpet. Shows the Tajik people shearing yaks.
